page.shortlink: api a5 scale image blob function
page.description: Scales an image blob. Input and output supported image types: .png, .jpg, .jpeg, .bmp. Scale is a decimal number. e.g. .5 = 50% of original size, 1.5 is 150% of original size. If scale is set to 0 you can specify maxSize - the dimension in inches or pixels of the height, width, or maximum dimension of the image. Units is 'inches' or 'pixels'. AppliesTo is 'Max', 'Width' or 'Height'.
page.syntax: B a5_scale_imageBlob(B blobIn ,C blobTypeIn ,C blobTypeOut ,N scale [,N maxSize [,C units [,C appliesTo [,C scaleMethod [,N width [,N height [,L flagOKToUseImageMagic ]]]]]]])

argument.name: blobTypeIn
argument.description: The type of the image to scale. Can be one of the following values: ".png", ".jpg", ".jpeg", ".bmp".

argument.name: blobTypeOut
argument.description: The type of the scaled image. Can be one of the following values: ".png", ".jpg", ".jpeg", ".bmp".

argument.name: scale
argument.description: A decimal number to scale the image. E.g. 0.5 = 50% of original size, 1.5 = 150% of original size. If size is 0, you can specify the maxSize property.

argument.name: maxSize
argument.description: Default = 0. The dimension in inches or pixels of the height, width, or maximum dimention of the image. This property is only used if scale is set to 0.

argument.name: units
argument.description: Default = "inches". Defines the dimension unit for the maxSize property. Can be "*[xb:inches]*" or "*[xb:pixels]*".

argument.name: appliesto
argument.description: Default = "Max". The dimension the maxSize is applied. appliesto can have a value of "*[xb:Width]*" (maxSize is applied to the image width), "*[xb:Height]*" (maxSize is applied to the image height), or "*[xb:Max]*" (maxSize is applied to larger of width and height.)
